heisig_chinese_memo: The samurai needs special garments for his attire since his body is much more robust than others.
Ru_trainchinese:
zhuāng: (графема) одежда, наряд; багаж, дорожная сумка
zhuāng: (глаг) притворяться; устанавливать; паковать, загружать; украшать, декорировать; наряжаться
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: The turtle samurai needs special clothing for his attire since his body is much more robust than others.
humanum_full_description_en:
From the sound of " clothing " and " zhuang ", the original meaning is wrapped and bound. "Shuowen": "Wrapped up. From clothes, strong voice." "Historical Records-Li Sheng Lu Jia Biography": "Give Lu Sheng a daughter who is straight in the dress, and he will also give him a daughter." Pei Qi quoted Zhang Yan: " Dress, wrap it up."

" Clothing " can mean clothes and clothing. "Selected Works‧Fu Yi "Dancing Fu"": "Gu Xingying, self-dressing. Follow the breeze and wave like fragrance." Li Shan's note: "Pretend, take it."

" Clothing " can also mean decoration and dressing up. Warring States Chu Song Yu "Dengtuzi Luscious Fu": "Beauty and beauty, don't wait for decoration."

" Loading " can also mean loading. "The Book of Jin-Dai Ruo'en Biography": "(Dai) met Lu Ji when he went to Los Angeles, and the ship was very well loaded, so he looted him.

" Pretend " also means to pretend or act. Song Sun Guangxian's "Bei Meng Suo Yan" Volume 6: "Once you have composed 50 poems, pretend to be Fang Gan's new system, the generations will praise and admire."

" Installation " can also refer to assembly and installation. "Romance of the Three Kingdoms" Chapter 106: "Earth artillery mounts, equipped with ladders, and fighting day and night."
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of " clothing " and " zhuang ", the original meaning is wrapped and bound.
humanum_full_description:
從「衣」，「壯」聲，本義為包裹、裹束。《說文》：「裹也。从衣，壯聲。」《史記‧酈生陸賈列傳》：「賜陸生橐中裝直千金，他送亦千金。」裴駰集解引張晏曰：「裝，裹也。」

　　「裝」可表示衣服、服裝。《文選‧傅毅〈舞賦〉》：「顧形影，自整裝。順微風，揮若芳。」李善注：「裝，服也。」

　　「裝」也可表示裝飾、打扮。戰國楚宋玉〈登徒子好色賦〉：「體美容冶，不待飾裝。」

　　「裝」還可表示裝載。《晉書‧戴若恩傳》：「（戴）遇陸機赴洛，船裝甚盛，遂與其徒掠之。」

　　「裝」亦表示假裝、扮演。宋孫光憲《北夢瑣言》卷六：「一旦頓作詩五十首，裝為方干新製，時輩吟賞降仰。」

　　「裝」還能指裝配、安裝。《三國演義》第106回：「立砲架，裝雲梯，日夜攻打不息。」
humanum_short_description: 從「衣」，「壯」聲，本義為包裹、裹束。

zhuang1
HSK 5: 装,裝
HSK 6: 妝,庄,妆,莊
裝裝RS
装装 		dress, clothes, attire, fill
  • clothes 衣 for a strong man 壯
(Simplified: 装)
Chinese Definition: Antonyms: 卸
Pictophonetic: 壯 indicates the sound; 衣 (clothes) conveys the meaning.
  • ⿱ Above to below
    • 壯 [ zhuàng ] big, large; robust, strong; the name of a tribe
    • 衣 [ yī ] cloth; clothes, apparel; dress, coat
①穿着的衣物：服裝。便裝。軍裝。中山裝。裝裹。
②特指演員演出時的穿戴打扮：上裝。卸裝。
③特指出行時帶的東西：治裝。整裝待發。
④特指工業生產或軍隊作戰所需的用具和器械：裝備。裝置。裝甲。
⑤用服飾改變人的原來原貌：化裝。喬裝打扮。
⑥假作，故意做作：佯裝。裝相。裝模作樣。
⑦安置，安放：裝載。裝卸。
⑧佈置，點綴：裝修。裝飾。
⑨特指對書籍、字畫加以修整或修整成的式樣：裝訂。裝幀。裝裱。線裝。精裝。裝潢(原指用黃檗汁染的紙裝裱書畫，現泛指裝飾物品使之美觀)。
⑩拆卸。
裝備 [ zhuāng bèi ]: equipment; to equip; to outfit
裝置 [ zhuāng zhì ]: to install; installation; equipment; system; unit; device

Chinese: The samurai needs special garments for his attire since his body is much more robust than others.
Meaning: attire
Hanzi: 装
Story: The turtle samurai needs special clothing for his attire since his body is much more robust than others.
Kind: traditional

從「 衣 」，「 壯 」聲，本義為包裹、裹束。《說文》：「裹也。从衣，壯聲。」《史記‧酈生陸賈列傳》：「賜陸生橐中裝直千金，他送亦千金。」裴駰集解引張晏曰：「裝，裹也。」 「 裝 」可表示衣服、服裝。《文選‧傅毅〈舞賦〉》：「顧形影，自整裝。順微風，揮若芳。」李善注：「裝，服也。」 「 裝 」也可表示裝飾、打扮。戰國楚宋玉〈登徒子好色賦〉：「體美容冶，不待飾裝。」 「 裝 」還可表示裝載。《晉書‧戴若恩傳》：「（戴）遇陸機赴洛，船裝甚盛，遂與其徒掠之。」 「 裝 」亦表示假裝、扮演。宋孫光憲《北夢瑣言》卷六：「一旦頓作詩五十首，裝為方干新製，時輩吟賞降仰。」 「 裝 」還能指裝配、安裝。《三國演義》第106回：「立砲架，裝雲梯，日夜攻打不息。」
From the sound of " clothing" and " zhuang", the original meaning is wrapped and bound. "Shuowen": "Wrapped up. From clothes, strong voice." "Historical Records-Li Sheng Lu Jia Biography": "Give Lu Sheng a daughter who is straight in the dress, and he will also give him a daughter." Pei Qi quoted Zhang Yan: " Dress, wrap it up." " Clothing" can mean clothes and clothing. "Selected Works‧Fu Yi "Dancing Fu"": "Gu Xingying, self-dressing. Follow the breeze and wave like fragrance." Li Shan's note: "Pretend, take it." " Clothing" can also mean decoration and dressing up. Warring States Chu Song Yu "Dengtuzi Luscious Fu": "Beauty and beauty, don't wait for decoration." " Loading" can also mean loading. "The Book of Jin-Dai Ruo'en Biography": "(Dai) met Lu Ji when he went to Los Angeles, and the ship was very well loaded, so he looted him. " Pretend" also means to pretend or act. Song Sun Guangxian's "Bei Meng Suo Yan" Volume 6: "Once you have composed 50 poems, pretend to be Fang Gan's new system, the generations will praise and admire." " Installation" can also refer to assembly and installation. "Romance of the Three Kingdoms" Chapter 106: "Earth artillery mounts, equipped with ladders, and fighting day and night."

裝字的基本解释

裝
zhuāng
见“装”。

裝字的汉语字典释义

[①]［zhuāng］
［《廣韻》側羊切，平陽，莊。］
［《廣韻》側亮切，去漾，荘。］
“装1”的繁体字。亦作“1”。
(1)行装。
(2)谓整理行装。
(3)衣物。亦泛指物品。
(4)衣服，服装。
(5)包裹；裹束。
(6)藏入；插入。
(7)装载。
(8)装饰；打扮。
(9)假装；扮演。
(10)引申为做；故意做作。
(11)装配；安装。
(12)对书籍、字画加以修整。
(13)指装订。
(14)通“壯”。气盛。

裝字的康熙字典解释

【申集下】【衣字部】　裝； 康熙笔画：13； 页码：页1118第01
【唐韻】【集韻】【韻會】?側羊切，音莊。裝束也。　又【玉篇】裹也。【前漢·陸賈傳】佗賜賈橐中裝，直千金。　又【增韻】齎也。【史記·袁盎傳】悉以其裝齎置二石醇醪。　又藏也。【孔稚圭·北山移文】牒訴倥傯裝其懷。　又【廣韻】側亮切，音壯。【吳均·贈別詩】匕首直千金，七寶雕華裝。生離何用表，賴此持相餉。　【韻會】亦作?。

裝字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

暂无。

(5) Wrap; wrapped bundle.
(6) Hidden; inserted.
(7) Loading.
(8) Decoration; dress up.
(9) Pretend; act.
(10) Extended to do; deliberately contrived.
(11) Assembly; installation.
(12) Renovate books, calligraphy and painting.
(13) Refers to binding.
(14) Through "Zhuang". arrogant.
